Description: Lip and wall sherd (mended from two fragments) of North Ionian black-figured pottery bowl; interior glazed with two added red bands lined in white; exterior, white slip: lion with raised paw to right; hindquarters of a fallow deer to right; red paint on mane and on lower belly of lion, white dots on haunch of fallow deer; top of lip glazed; incision used for details of lion and of deer.
Bibliographic references: Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GG.217)
